title: Drawing, "Proposed Design for the South Wall of the Entrance Hall", 1819–20
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Horizontal rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Elevation of a wall, with a mantelpiece in the center, flanked by two doorways. Over the mantelpiece appears the painted representation of a banner on which is shown a cavalry group. Trophies above and on either side are representations of columns and trophies of military connotation, and dragons above. Doorways with carved and painted decoration.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Proposed Design for the South Wall of the Entrance Hall", 1819–20.
1819–20. Pencil on paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-4.
